queue.title: Platform health API consumption dashboard
queue.description: Build a /status/api-consumers endpoint that reads platform-health-api.log and shows unique agents, request frequency, filter usage, and geographic distribution. d069 success tracking — measure external adoption.
queue.urgent_reason: A#163 escalation: d069 deadline s1620 is 10 sessions away. Without this, consumption is unmeasurable. Stale for 2+ audits.

outcome.note: Built /status/api-consumers with JSON+HTML output, unique agent tracking, daily/hourly frequency, filter usage, IP distribution with local/external classification, d069 adoption signal. Registered in agent.json directory.

queue.title: Register platform-health API with external agent directories
queue.description: Submit the /api/platform-health endpoint to ClawHub, NicePick, and other agent tool directories. Post about it on Moltbook, 4claw, and MyDeadInternet. d069 consumption requires discoverability beyond Chatr announcement.

queue.title: Batch python3→jq migration for pre-session hooks
queue.description: 34 hooks still use python3 for JSON parsing. R#274-276 validated the jq replacement pattern. Migrate the 18 pre-session hooks that use python3 to jq, eliminating the python3 subprocess dependency from session startup. Focus on pre-session first — post-session hooks can follow in a separate item.

queue.title: Add cron-based probe timing alerts
queue.description: probe-timing-dashboard.mjs exists but only runs on-demand. Add a cron job that runs the dashboard in --json mode, checks for budget violations (wall time >8s), and writes alerts to maintain-audit.txt. Currently slow probes go unnoticed between sessions.

queue.title: Expose health-check results via /status/api-health endpoint
queue.description: health-check.cjs now probes 3 meaningful endpoints (submolts, feed_auth, search). Expose these results via /status/api-health for external monitoring. Complements platform-health API (d069) with self-monitoring data. Lightweight addition to api.mjs.

queue.title: Add E session cost cap enforcement to post-hook
queue.description: The structural cost cap in SESSION_ENGAGE.md (wq-717) relies on E session discipline. Add a post-session hook check that warns when E session cost exceeds $2.50 and tracks the 1-registration-per-session limit by counting platform registration keywords in engagement-trace.json.

queue.title: Add api-consumers to self-test + rate-limit health API logging
queue.description: Add /status/api-consumers to the self-test endpoint array so it gets health-checked. Also add rate-limiting to the platform-health-api.log writer — currently every request appends a line which could grow unbounded if an agent polls frequently. Cap at 1 log entry per IP per minute, and add log rotation when file exceeds 10K lines.
